snippet: The Platters, with hits like “Only You” and “The Great Pretender,” were one of the first groups to be promoted across racial barriers. Mr. Reed was credited with naming the group in 1953.
abstract: Herb Reed, last surviving original member of the Platters, one of the first pop music groups to break the color barrier in the 1950s, dies at age 83.
lead_paragraph: The Platters, with hits like “Only You” and “The Great Pretender,” were one of the first groups to be promoted across racial barriers. Mr. Reed was credited with naming the group in 1953.

headline.seo: Herb Reed, an Original Platter, Dies at 83
headline.main: Herb Reed, an Original Platter, Dies at 83
headline.print_headline: Herb Reed, an Original Platter, Dies at 83
